definitions.definition: The inevitable progression into the future with the passing of present and past events.
definitions.example: Time stops for nobody.   the ebb and flow of time

definitions.definition: The measurement under some system of region of day or moment.
definitions.example: Let's synchronize our watches so we're not on different time.
your car runs three times faster than mine;  that is four times as heavy as this

definitions.definition: The measured duration of sounds; measure; tempo; rate of movement; rhythmical division.
definitions.example: common or triple time;   the musician keeps good time.

definitions.definition: To measure or record the time, duration, or rate of.
definitions.example: I used a stopwatch to time myself running around the block.

definitions.definition: To choose when something begins or how long it lasts.
definitions.example: The President timed his speech badly, coinciding with the Super Bowl.

definitions.definition: To keep or beat time; to proceed or move in time.
To regulate as to time; to accompany, or agree with, in time of movement.
To measure, as in music or harmony.
The circumstances of a certain time.
definitions.example: Modern times are so very different from the past.
The Life and Times of Rosie the Riveter.
